about_the_game:
[Notice] Please ensure your computer meets the following requirements:

1. You need any headset that supports SteamVR.

2. Please make sure you are using an NVIDIA 3060 or above. AMD and Intel GPUs are not supported at this time.

3. Ensure that the JUMPWORK cameras are connected to two separate, non-shared bandwidth USB 3.0 ports.

- Want to have your own legs in VR?

- Tired of spending half an hour setting up just to play for ten minutes?

- Had enough of the hassle of wearable full-body tracking?

- Had already tried non-wearable tracking solutions but feel disappointed? High latency? Unstable and inconsistent? Low accuracy? Only support single cam? Turn around lost tracking?

Try the new solution we built 3 years by JUMPWORK.AI:

Achieve 360-degree, high-precision, non-wearable full-body tracking with just 1 or 2 depth cameras.

• Set up in 1 second

• Up to 9 trackers covering your lower body and elbows

What can it do?

• Show off, dance, and most importantly, ERP or kick whoever you want, whenever you want in VR.

• Supports stepping-in-place movement* so you can finally have your own legs in VR.

• Offers 3D reconstruction that can be imported into Unity and used in VRChat, or even for reconstructing small objects*.

• For studio users, we provide a low-cost solution for recording skeletal data files (motion capture).

Note: Features marked with an * are still in the testing phase. Beta versions will be released at anytime and may be unavailable anytime until stable.
detailed_description:
[Notice] Please ensure your computer meets the following requirements:

1. You need any headset that supports SteamVR.

2. Please make sure you are using an NVIDIA 3060 or above. AMD and Intel GPUs are not supported at this time.

3. Ensure that the JUMPWORK cameras are connected to two separate, non-shared bandwidth USB 3.0 ports.

- Want to have your own legs in VR?

- Tired of spending half an hour setting up just to play for ten minutes?

- Had enough of the hassle of wearable full-body tracking?

- Had already tried non-wearable tracking solutions but feel disappointed? High latency? Unstable and inconsistent? Low accuracy? Only support single cam? Turn around lost tracking?

Try the new solution we built 3 years by JUMPWORK.AI:

Achieve 360-degree, high-precision, non-wearable full-body tracking with just 1 or 2 depth cameras.

• Set up in 1 second

• Up to 9 trackers covering your lower body and elbows

What can it do?

• Show off, dance, and most importantly, ERP or kick whoever you want, whenever you want in VR.

• Supports stepping-in-place movement* so you can finally have your own legs in VR.

• Offers 3D reconstruction that can be imported into Unity and used in VRChat, or even for reconstructing small objects*.

• For studio users, we provide a low-cost solution for recording skeletal data files (motion capture).

Note: Features marked with an * are still in the testing phase. Beta versions will be released at anytime and may be unavailable anytime until stable.
legal_notice:
Terms of Service and Privacy Policy
JUMPWORK Software Terms of Service and Privacy Policy

Introduction

Welcome to using the JUMPWORK software and services!

To use the JUMPWORK software (hereinafter referred to as "this software") and services, you should read and comply with the

"JUMPWORK Software License and Service Agreement" (hereinafter referred to as "this agreement"). Please make sure to carefully

read and fully understand the contents of each clause, especially those that exempt or limit liability, and separate agreements for opening

or using specific services, and choose whether to accept or reject them. Terms of restriction and exemption may be highlighted in bold to

draw your attention.

Unless you have read and accepted all the terms of this agreement, you are not authorized to download, install, or use this software and r

elated services. Your downloading, installation, usage, obtaining of an JUMPWORK account, logging in, and other actions will be deemed

as having read and agreed to be bound by the aforementioned agreements.

If you are under 18 years old, please read this agreement and the aforementioned other agreements with the company of your legal guardian,

and pay special attention to the terms for minors.

1. Scope of the Agreement

1.1 Scope of the Agreement

This agreement is an agreement between you and JUMPWORK regarding your download, installation, use, and reproduction of this

software, as well as your use of related services provided by JUMPWORK.

1.2 Relationship and Conflict of Agreements

This agreement is considered a supplementary agreement to the "JUMPWORK Service Agreement" and constitutes an integral part of it,

forming a unified whole. In case of conflict between this agreement and the above-mentioned content, this agreement shall prevail.

The content of this agreement also includes relevant agreements, business rules, and other content that JUMPWORK may continuously

issue regarding this service. Once the above content is officially released, it becomes an inseparable part of this agreement, and you must

also comply.

2. About This Service

2.1 Contents of the Service

The content of this service refers to the cross-platform body capture tool (hereinafter referred to as "JUMPWORK") provided by

JUMPWORK to users, supporting software licenses and services (hereinafter referred to as "this service") such as single-person

participation, recording, live broadcasting, PC VR motion capture streaming, etc.

2.2 Form of the Service

2.2.1 You need to download the JUMPWORK client software to use this service. For this software, JUMPWORK grants you a personal,

non-transferable, and non-exclusive license. The JUMPWORK official website, Windows version, etc., require account passwords or QR

code scanning to log in. You may only use these software and services for the purpose of accessing or using this service.

2.2.2 The JUMPWORK client software provided in this service may offer various application versions, including but not limited to iOS,

Android, Windows Phone, Symbian, BlackBerry, Windows, Mac, etc. Users must choose the software version that matches the installed

terminal device.

2.3 Scope of the Service License

2.3.1 JUMPWORK grants you a personal, non-transferable, and non-exclusive license to use this software. You may install, use, display,

and run this software on a single terminal device for non-commercial purposes.

2.3.2 You may make one backup copy of this software for the purpose of using this software and services, provided that the backup copy must

contain all copyright information contained in the original software.

2.3.3 All rights not explicitly authorized by this clause and other terms of this agreement are still reserved by JUMPWORK. You must

obtain a separate written license from JUMPWORK to exercise these rights. If JUMPWORK does not exercise any of the

aforementioned rights, it does not constitute a waiver of such rights.

3. Obtaining the Software

3.1 You may obtain this software directly from the JUMPWORK website or from a third party authorized by JUMPWORK.

3.2 If you obtain this software or installation programs of the same name from a third party not authorized by JUMPWORK,

JUMPWORK cannot guarantee the normal use of the software and is not responsible for any losses caused to you as a result.

4. Installation and Uninstallation of the Software

4.1 JUMPWORK may develop different software versions for different terminal devices, and you should choose to download the

appropriate version based on actual conditions for installation.

4.2 After downloading the installation program, you need to correctly install it according to the steps prompted by the program.

4.3 To provide better and safer services, JUMPWORK may recommend other software for you to install during the installation of this

software. You can choose to install or not install.

4.4 If you no longer need to use this software or need to install a new version of the software, you can uninstall it yourself. If you are willing

to help JUMPWORK improve its product and services, please inform us of the reason for uninstallation.

5. Software Updates

5.1 To improve user experience and enhance service content, JUMPWORK will continuously strive to develop new services and provide

you with software updates from time to time (these updates may take the form of software replacement, modification, function enhancement,

version upgrade, etc.).

5.2 To ensure the security and consistency of this software and service, JUMPWORK has the right to update the software without special

notice to you, or to change or limit some functions or effects of the software.

5.3 After the release of a new version of this software, the old version of the software may not be available. JUMPWORK does not

guarantee the continued availability of the old version of the software and the corresponding customer service. Please check and download

the latest version at any time.

6. Protection of User Personal Information

6.1 Protecting user personal information is a fundamental principle of JUMPWORK. JUMPWORK will take reasonable measures to

protect user personal information. Except as required by laws and regulations, JUMPWORK will not disclose or reveal user personal

information to third parties without user permission. JUMPWORK uses professional encryption storage and transmission methods to

protect the security of user personal information.

6.2 During the process of registering an account or using this service, you need to provide some necessary information, such as: to provide

you with account registration services or to perform user identity identification, you need to fill in your mobile phone number; for the nearby

people feature, you need to agree to use your geographical location information; the phone contact matching feature requires you to

authorize access to the phone contact list, etc. If national laws, regulations, or policies have special provisions, you need to provide true

identity information. If the information you provide is incomplete, you may not be able to use this service or may be restricted in the process

of use. 6.3 Under normal circumstances, you can browse and modify the information you submit at any time, but for security and identity

recognition reasons (such as number appeal services), you may not be able to modify the initial registration information and other verification

information provided at the time of registration. If you register a new JUMPWORK account through an existing JUMPWORK account,

JUMPWORK will regard the new JUMPWORK account as having the same initial registration mobile phone number as the

aforementioned "existing JUMPWORK account".

6.4 JUMPWORK will use various security technologies and programs to establish a sound management system to protect your personal

nformation from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure.

6.5 Without your consent, JUMPWORK will not disclose your personal information to any company, organization, or individual outside of

JUMPWORK, except as otherwise provided by law and regulations.

6.6 JUMPWORK pays great attention to the protection of minors' personal information. If you are a minor under 18 years of age, you

should obtain your parents' or legal guardian's written consent before using JUMPWORK's services.

6.7 For how JUMPWORK collects, uses, stores, and protects your personal information, as well as the rights you enjoy, you can also

read the "JUMPWORK Privacy Protection Guidelines" for further understanding.

7. Main Rights and Obligations

7.1 Account Usage Guidelines

7.1.1 Before using this service, you need to register an JUMPWORK account. The JUMPWORK account can be registered through

a mobile phone number or through the assistance of an existing JUMPWORK account. The JUMPWORK account will be bound to

the registered mobile phone number. After successful registration, you can bind a mobile phone number, and under the premise of complying

with the platform rules, you can change the bound mobile phone number. JUMPWORK has the right to stipulate the prerequisite

conditions, the number of accounts that can be registered, and other related matters for the auxiliary registration of a new JUMPWORK

account through an existing JUMPWORK account, as displayed on the product page.

JUMPWORK has the right to change the registration and binding methods of accounts based on user needs or product requirements.

7.1.2 The ownership of the JUMPWORK account belongs to JUMPWORK. After completing the registration procedures, users only

obtain the right to use the JUMPWORK account, and this right only belongs to the initial applicant. At the same time, the initial applicant

shall not gift, borrow, rent, transfer or sell the JUMPWORK account, nor permit non-initial applicants to use the JUMPWORK account

in any other way. Non-initial applicants may not use the JUMPWORK account through gifting, inheritance, renting, transferring, or any

other means.

7.1.3 Users are responsible for properly safeguarding their registered account information and passwords and are legally accountable for all

actions taken under the registered account and password. Users agree not to disclose account and password information to others under any

circumstances. If you suspect someone is using your account, you should immediately notify JUMPWORK. If you register a new

JUMPWORK account with the assistance of an existing JUMPWORK account, JUMPWORK may, for the purpose of ensuring your

account security, require you to use the aforementioned "existing JUMPWORK account" for related auxiliary operations, including but not

limited to auxiliary login, password recovery, account freezing, and submitting appeals. If you bind the new JUMPWORK account to a

different mobile phone number than the one associated with the aforementioned "existing JUMPWORK account," the aforementioned "

existing JUMPWORK account" will lose the ability to perform related auxiliary operations for the new JUMPWORK account, and this

action is irreversible, so you should proceed with caution.

7.1.4 When registering for an JUMPWORK account using a mobile phone number, the system will automatically assign you an

JUMPWORK ID. You can set your JUMPWORK ID and, under certain conditions, modify it according to the guidance on the relevant

function page.

7.1.5 When using specific services or features of the software client, you may be required to create or register a new account (hereinafter

referred to as a "functional account") based on your JUMPWORK account. You must follow specific requirements for operation. Unless

otherwise stated or permitted in writing by JUMPWORK, the ownership of the aforementioned account also belongs to JUMPWORK.

After creating or registering the account, the user only obtains the right to use the account, and this right also only belongs to the initial

applicant. The initial applicant shall not gift, borrow, rent, transfer, or sell the account, nor permit non-initial applicants to use the account in

any other way. Non-initial applicants may not use the account through gifting, inheritance, renting, transferring, or any other means.

7.1.6 If you do not log in to your registered JUMPWORK account or functional account for an extended period, JUMPWORK has the

right to reclaim the account to avoid resource waste. Any losses incurred as a result are the sole responsibility of the user.

7.2 User Considerations

7.2.1 You understand and agree that to provide you with effective services, this software may use your terminal device's processor and

bandwidth resources. The use of this software may generate data traffic fees, and users must independently inquire with their operators about

related charges and bear the costs themselves.

7.2.2 You understand and agree that certain functions of this software may allow third parties to know your information. For example, your

JUMPWORK friends can query your avatar, name, JUMPWORK ID, or public personal information like your moments. If you choose to

interconnect JUMPWORK with other software or hardware, the provider of the other software or hardware may obtain the information you

have actively disclosed or transmitted in JUMPWORK. You should fully understand the product features and information protection

policies of other software or hardware before making a selection.

7.2.3 When using specific services of this software, there may be separate agreements or related business rules (collectively referred to as

"separate agreements"). Please read and agree to the relevant separate agreements before using these services. Your use of the

aforementioned specific services will be deemed as your acceptance of the relevant separate agreements.

7.2.4 You understand and agree that JUMPWORK will make commercially reasonable efforts to ensure the security of your data stored in

this software and service. However, JUMPWORK cannot provide a complete guarantee, including but not limited to the following

circumstances:

7.2.4.1 JUMPWORK is not responsible for the deletion or storage failure of your related data in this software and service;

7.2.4.2 JUMPWORK has the right to independently determine the maximum storage period for each user's data in this software and service

based on actual conditions and allocate the maximum storage space on the server. You can independently back up related data in this software

and service as needed;

7.2.4.3 If you stop using this software and service, or if the service is terminated or canceled, JUMPWORK may permanently delete your

data from the server. After the service is stopped, terminated, or canceled, JUMPWORK has no obligation to return any data to you.

7.2.5 When using this software and service, users must independently bear the following risks beyond JUMPWORK's control, including but

not limited to:

7.2.5.1 Personal information loss or leakage caused by force majeure;

7.2.5.2 Users must choose a software version that matches the installed terminal device. Otherwise, any problems or damages caused by

incompatibility between the software and the terminal device model are the user's responsibility;

7.2.5.3 When accessing third-party websites through this software, users are responsible for the risks that may arise from third-party websites

and related content;

7.2.5.4 The risks and responsibilities arising from your content being forwarded or shared by others;

7.2.5.5 The risks caused by JUMPWORK login failure, incomplete data synchronization, slow opening speed, etc., due to unstable wireless

network signals, small wireless network bandwidth, and other reasons; the risks of low accuracy, unstable products, and capture failure caused

by the computer configuration not meeting the minimum configuration standard;

7.2.5.6You understand and agree that during the use of this service, you may encounter force majeure and other risk factors that may cause the

interruption of this service. Force majeure refers to objective events that cannot be foreseen, overcome, and avoided and have a significant

impact on one or both parties, including but not limited to natural disasters such as floods, earthquakes, storms, epidemics, and social events

such as wars, turmoil, and government actions.

7.3 Third-Party Products and Services

7.3.1 When using third-party products or services provided by this software, in addition to complying with this agreement, you must also

comply with the third-party's user agreement. JUMPWORK and the third party shall each bear responsibility for any disputes that may

arise within the scope of legal provisions and agreements.

7.3.2 When using this software or requesting JUMPWORK to provide specific services, this software may call third-party systems or

support users' use or access through third parties. The results of the use or access are provided by the third party (including but not limited to

services provided by third parties through the JUMPWORK public account or content accessed through the open platform), and

JUMPWORK does not guarantee the safety, accuracy, effectiveness, and other uncertain risks of services and content provided by third

parties. Any disputes and damages arising from this are unrelated to JUMPWORK, and JUMPWORK does not bear any responsibility.

7.3.3 You understand and agree that JUMPWORK has the right to decide to use this software for commercial purposes, including but not

limited to developing and using parts of this software's services for third-party promotion. JUMPWORK promises to strictly protect your

personal information during the promotion process in accordance with this agreement. You can also choose to block or refuse to receive

related promotional information based on system settings.

8. User Behavior Guidelines

8.1 Information Content Guidelines

8.1.1 The information content referred to in this article includes any content created, copied, published, or transmitted by users during their

use of this software and service, including but not limited to the avatar, name, user description, profile, etc., of the JUMPWORK account or

functional account, or information sent such as text, voice, pictures, videos, emojis, data generated during motion capture such as images and

point clouds, data content and related link pages, and other content generated using the JUMPWORK account or functional account or

this software and service.

8.1.2 You understand and agree that JUMPWORK has always been committed to providing users with a civilized, healthy, and orderly

online environment. You may not use the JUMPWORK account or functional account or this software and service to create, copy, publish,

or transmit the following content that interferes with the normal operation of JUMPWORK and infringes on the legal rights of other users

or third parties, including but not limited to:

8.1.2.1 Publishing, transmitting, spreading, or storing content that violates national laws and regulations:

(1) Violating the basic principles established by the Constitution;

(2) Endangering national security, leaking state secrets, subverting state power, undermining national unity;

(3) Damaging national honor and interests;

(4) Inciting ethnic hatred, ethnic discrimination, undermining ethnic unity;

(5) Undermining state religious policies, promoting cults and feudal superstitions;

(6) Spreading rumors, disturbing social order, undermining social stability;

(7) Spreading obscenity, pornography, gambling, violence, terror, or abetting crimes;

(8) Insulting or slandering others, infringing on others' legitimate rights and interests;

(9) Inciting illegal gatherings, associations, marches, demonstrations, crowds to disturb social order;

(10) Engaging in activities in the name of illegal civil organizations;

(11) "Content that does not comply with the 'Interim Provisions on the Administration of the Development of Public Information Services for

Instant Messaging Tools' and the 'Seven Baselines' requirements of adhering to laws and regulations, the socialist system, national interests,

citizens' legitimate interests, public order, social morality, and information authenticity."

(12) Content prohibited by laws, administrative regulations, or other regulations.

8.1.2.2 Publishing, transmitting, spreading, or storing content that infringes upon others' rights, such as reputation, portrait, intellectual

property, and trade secrets;

8.1.2.3 Involving others' privacy, personal information, or materials;

8.1.2.4 Publishing, transmitting, or spreading content that harasses, includes advertisements, excessive marketing information, spam, or any

sexual or sexually suggestive content;

8.1.2.5 Other information that violates laws, regulations, policies, public order, good customs, social ethics, or interferes with the normal

operation of JUMPWORK and infringes on the legal rights of other users or third parties.

8.2 Software Usage Specifications

8.2.1 Unless permitted by law or with written permission from JUMPWORK, you may not engage in the following behaviors while using

this software:

8.2.1.1 Deleting copyright information from the software and its copies;

8.2.1.2 Reverse engineering, disassembling, decompiling, or attempting to discover the source code of the software;

8.2.1.3 Using, renting, lending, copying, modifying, linking, reprinting, compiling, publishing, or creating mirror sites for content owned by

JUMPWORK's intellectual property rights;

8.2.1.4 Copying, modifying, increasing, deleting, hooking, running, or creating any derivative works from the data released to any terminal

memory during the operation of the software, the interaction data between the client and the server during the operation of the software, and

the system data necessary for the operation of the software, including but not limited to using plugins, external tools, or unauthorized

third-party tools/services to access the software and related systems;

8.2.1.5 Modifying or forging software operation instructions and data, increasing, deleting, or changing the software's functions or operation

effects, or operating or transmitting software, methods, or processes used for the aforementioned purposes, whether for commercial purposes

or not;

8.2.1.6 Logging in or using JUMPWORK software and services through non-JUMPWORK developed or authorized third-party software,

plugins, external tools, or systems, or creating, publishing, and spreading such tools;

8.2.1.7 Interfering with the software and its components, modules, or data by yourself or by authorizing others, third-party software;

8.2.1.8 Any other behaviors not expressly authorized by JUMPWORK.

8.2.2 You understand and agree that based on user experience, JUMPWORK or the operating security of related service platforms,

platform rules requirements, and healthy development, JUMPWORK has the right to choose the service objects, determine the function

settings, and decide the scope of function opening, data interface, and related data disclosure. For the following situations, JUMPWORK

has the right to suspend or terminate the provision of this service based on specific circumstances, including but not limited to:

8.2.2.1 Violation of laws, regulations, or the provisions of this agreement;

8.2.2.2 Affecting service experience;

8.2.2.3 The existence of security risks;

8.2.2.4 Similar or identical to the main functions or components of JUMPWORK or its service platform, or can realize the main effects of the

aforementioned functions or components;

8.2.2.5 Interface, style, function, description, or user experience is similar to JUMPWORK or its service platform, which may cause

JUMPWORK users to believe that the functions or services they are using come from or are authorized by JUMPWORK;

8.2.2.6 Violation of JUMPWORK or its service platform operating principles or not meeting other management requirements of

JUMPWORK.

8.3 Service Operation Specifications

Unless permitted by law or with written permission from JUMPWORK, you may not engage in the following behaviors while using this

service:

8.3.1 Submitting or publishing false information or impersonating others;

8.3.2 Inducing other users to click on links or share information;

8.3.3 Fabricating facts or concealing the truth to mislead or deceive others;

8.3.4 Infringing upon others' rights, such as reputation, portrait, intellectual property, and trade secrets;

8.3.5 Without written permission from JUMPWORK, using JUMPWORK accounts, functional accounts, and any functions, as well as

third-party platforms for promotion or mutual promotion;

8.3.6 Engaging in any illegal or criminal activities using JUMPWORK accounts, functional accounts, or this software and services;

8.3.7 Creating, publishing, or spreading methods or tools related to the above behaviors, or operating or spreading such methods or tools,

whether for commercial purposes or not;

8.3.8 Other behaviors that violate laws, regulations, infringe on the legitimate rights and interests of other users, interfere with the normal

operation of the product, or are not expressly authorized by JUMPWORK.

8.4 Responsibility for Your Actions

You fully understand and agree that you must be responsible for all actions under your registered account, including any content you post,

comments, likes, recommendations, and any consequences arising therefrom. You should independently judge the content in this service and

bear all risks arising from using the content, including reliance on the correctness, completeness, or practicality of the content. JUMPWORK

cannot and will not be liable for any loss or damage caused by the aforementioned risks.

8.5 Breach Handling

8.5.1 If JUMPWORK finds or receives reports or complaints that users have violated this agreement, JUMPWORK has the right to

delete or block the relevant content without notice, and based on the severity of the behavior, impose penalties on the offending subject,

including but not limited to warnings, restrictions or prohibitions on using some or all functions, account suspension, or even cancellation,

and announce the handling results.

8.5.2 You understand and agree that JUMPWORK has the right to make reasonable judgments and take appropriate legal actions against

users who violate relevant laws, regulations, or the provisions of this agreement, and save relevant information according to laws and

regulations and report to relevant authorities, and users shall bear all legal responsibilities arising therefrom independently.

8.5.3 You understand and agree that if you violate this agreement or related service terms, resulting in any claims, demands, or losses from

third parties, you shall be independently liable; if JUMPWORK suffers losses as a result, you shall also compensate JUMPWORK

accordingly.

9. Intellectual Property Statement

9.1 JUMPWORK is the intellectual property rights holder of this software. All intellectual property rights, including but not limited to

copyrights, trademark rights, patent rights, and trade secrets, as well as all information content related to this software (including but not

limited to text, pictures, audio, video, graphics, interface design, layout framework, related data, or electronic documents), are protected by

the laws and regulations of the People's Republic of China and relevant international treaties, and JUMPWORK enjoys the above

intellectual property rights, except for the rights that should be enjoyed by the relevant rights holders according to law.

9.2 Without written permission from JUMPWORK or the relevant rights holders, you may not implement, use, or transfer the above

intellectual property rights for any commercial or non-commercial purposes.

9.3 All content you upload or publish during the use of this software and service will not result in the transfer of intellectual property rights,

portrait rights, or other rights due to the upload or publication behavior. Meanwhile, you understand and agree that to achieve the product's

purpose, JUMPWORK has the right to use the specific public non-confidential content (such as "video updates," "selfie expressions," and

"video content") you publish within the scope permitted by law, including but not limited to storage, playback to relevant users, allowing

relevant users to access and reuse, etc.

10. Terminal Security Responsibility

10.1 You understand and agree that this software, like most Internet software, may be affected by multiple factors, including but not limited to

user reasons, network service quality, social environment, etc.; it may also be subject to various security issues, including but not limited to

others illegally using user data, causing harassment in reality; other software downloaded or visited by users may contain viruses, Trojan horse

programs, or other malicious programs, threatening your terminal device's information and data security, and thus affecting the normal use of

this software. Therefore, you should strengthen your awareness of information security and personal information protection, and pay attention

to password protection to avoid losses.

10.2 You shall not create, publish, use, or spread malicious programs intended to steal JUMPWORK accounts, functional accounts, or

others' personal information and property.

10.3 Maintaining software security and normal use is a joint responsibility between JUMPWORK and you. JUMPWORK will take

necessary technical measures to protect your terminal device's information and data security according to industry standards, but you

acknowledge and agree that JUMPWORK cannot provide a complete guarantee.

10.4 Under no circumstances should you trust online requests for loans, passwords, or other financial information. Always verify the identity of

the other party before engaging in any financial transactions, and regularly review JUMPWORK’s warnings about preventing fraud.

11 Third-Party Software or Technology

11.1 This software may use third-party software or technology (including open-source code and public domain code, etc., hereinafter the

same), and such use has been legally authorized.

11.2 If this software uses third-party software or technology, JUMPWORK will, in accordance with relevant regulations or agreements,

display related agreements or other documents, which may be shown as attachments to this agreement, packaged in a specific folder within

the software installation package, or displayed on the open-source software page. These may be expressed in the form of "Software Use

License Agreement", "Authorization Agreement", "Open Source Code License" or other forms. The aforementioned agreements, other

documents, and webpages displayed through various forms are inseparable parts of this agreement and have the same legal effect as this

agreement. You must comply with these requirements. If you fail to comply with these requirements, the third party or state authority may file

a lawsuit, fine, or take other punitive measures against you, and may request JUMPWORK’s assistance, in which case you shall bear the

legal responsibility yourself.

11.3 If any dispute arises from the use of third-party software or technology in this software, it should be resolved by the third party.

JUMPWORK does not assume any responsibility. JUMPWORK does not provide customer support for third-party software or

technology. If you need support, please contact the third party directly.

12 Miscellaneous

12.1 Your use of this software indicates that you have read and agree to be bound by this agreement. JUMPWORK reserves the right to

modify the terms of this agreement when necessary. You can check the relevant terms of the agreement in the latest version of this software.

If you continue to use the software after the terms of this agreement have been changed, it is deemed that you have accepted the modified

agreement. If you do not accept the modified agreement, you should stop using the software.

12.2 This agreement is signed in the Economic and Technological Development Zone of Nanjing, Jiangsu Province, People's Republic of China.

12.3 The establishment, effectiveness, performance, interpretation, and dispute resolution of this agreement shall be governed by the laws of

mainland China (excluding conflict of laws).

12.4 If any dispute or controversy arises between you and JUMPWORK, you should first attempt to resolve it through friendly negotiation;

if negotiation fails, you agree to submit the dispute or controversy to the court with jurisdiction where this agreement is signed.

12.5 All headings in this agreement are provided for ease of reading only and have no actual meaning and cannot be used as a basis for

interpreting the meaning of this agreement.

12.6 This agreement may be available in multiple languages, including Chinese and English. In the event of a conflict between the Chinese

version and versions in other languages, the Chinese version shall prevail.

12.7 If any part of the terms of this agreement is invalid or unenforceable for any reason, the remaining terms shall remain valid and binding

on both parties.
name: JUMPWORK

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: i5-12400
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 3060
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 10 GB available space
  • VR Support: ALL PC VR HMD
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: i7-11700
  • Memory: 32 GB RAM
  • Graphics: RTX 4090
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 20 GB available space
  • VR Support: ALL PC VR HMD

short_description: JUMPWORK I is back! After receiving a ton of negative reviews, we have returned with our self-developed JUMPWORK I, completely revamped and ready for action! JUMPWORK I is a seamless VR FBT system that requires no charging or wearing.
